title: Update dependencies
body:
Would be nice to get this in a release.

Given the lack of activity, what will maintenance be like going forward?

title: Add a batch size option to similarity and anology queries
body:
This allows the user to trade-off efficiency for lower memory use.

@sebpuetz I am not sure if we want to break the current API or add new methods for this functionality (like `similarity_batched`).

In favor of adding new trait methods:

* The API does not change.

Against adding new trait methods:

* `Analogy` and `EmbeddingSimilarity` already have 2 methods, this would double the number to 4.

title: Relicense to Apache License 2.0 or MIT
body:
Ack'ed by:

- Daniël de Kok
- Sebastian Pütz
- Nianheng Wu
- Dirkjan Ochtman
- SfS ISCL

title: Make serialized chunk and embeddings lengths queryable
body:
This PR adds two trait methods and their implementations:

* `WriteChunk::chunk_len`
* `WriteEmbeddings::write_embeddings_len`

The goal of these methods is to give the serialized length of finalfusion chunks or embedding matrices. This makes it possible to write the embeddings in a preallocated buffer without resizing speed/memory overhead.

I have also extended the tests a bit, checking lengths wit different file offsets (to check that the lengths are computed correctly with e.g. padding).

title: Improve error handling
body:
- `Error::context`: mark the inner error as the error source. This
  allows a downstream error handler (e.g. anyhow) to format the error
  chain nicely.
- Rename `Error::Shape` to `Error::MatrixShape` to narrow down the scope
  of the variant. Mark the shape error as the error source.
- Split `Error::Io` into `Error::{read, write}`. Mark the wrapped
  `io::Error` as the error source.
- Do not use debug representations of values in errors, we want their
  string representations instead.
- Remove the `Error` suffix from some variants. They are part of an
  error enum, we know that they are errors :^).

title: Add batch embedding lookups
body:
This change adds the `embedding_batch` and `embedding_batch_into` methods.
These methods look up the embeddings for multiple words. The motivation
is threefold:

1. It provides the convenience of looking up multiple embeddings at
   once.
2. Words which occur more than once in the batch only need to be looked
   up once.
3. These method can avoid some allocations if the downstream user is
   concatenating the embeddings in a batch anyway.

---

For multiple occurrences of a word, the embedding is first realized in-place for the first occurrence of that word and then copied into the other rows in which the word occurs. I am not sure if using `multi_slice_mut` here is too convoluted. It avoids an allocation in the case of a ~known word~, since it will be copied into the output matrix in-place. ~Currently, I don't think it provides a benefit for unknown words, since for those we first look up multiple embeddings and sum then anyway.~

@sebpuetz let me know what you think. If we think it's premature implementation, I'll revert the implementation to what I had earlier (fetch the embedding into a temporary and then copy that temporary into all rows).

title: Add a finalfusion chunk for floret vocabs
Support conversion to StorageViewWrap for floret embeddings
Improve indexing scope handling
body:
This PR combines two changes:

* Move down `IndicesScope` handling to `SubwordIndices` trait. This is a better place to do this, because e.g. finalfrontier uses the `SubwordIndices` trait.
* Add the `Indexer::scope` method. This allows us to get the indexing scope from the indexer, rather than passing it around everywhere.

title: Update some information in the README
body:
- Cargo.toml example snippet.
- Mention floret format support.

title: WriteFloretText: write correct number of buckets in header
body:
The size of the full vocabulary was written, rather than only the number
of buckets.

title: Support FloretSubwordVocab in VocabWrap
body:
Support for writing FloretSubwordVocab chunks is currently not
implemented.

title: Add support for writing floret embeddings
Add support for Floret embeddings
body:
Add support for reading and using Floret embeddings. Floret combines subword
embeddings with Bloom embeddings:

https://github.com/explosion/floret#how-floret-works

This allows Floret embedding matrices to be compact like Bloom embeddings,
while also using subword units.

Supporting Floret embeddings requires some architectural changes to
finalfusion:

1. ngrams -> index mappings are many-to-many

   finalfusion assumed that each n-gram maps to a single index. In Floret
   embeddings, an n-gram can map to multiple embeddings. finalfusion is
   extended in this change to support returning multiple indices for an
   n-gram.

2. Floret also hashes the word itself, not just the subwords. This change
   adds a boolean flag. If it is enabled, the word itself is also hashed,
   and its index is returned.

3. Floret permits different begin/end-of-word markers. These are made
   configurable for subword vocabs.

title: Apply small fixes across the crate
Fix Clippy lints and pin Rust version for Clippy
body:
- Fix clippy lints
- Pin the Rust version for clippy

title: Switch from memmap to memmap2
body:
memmap is no longer maintained, and the RustSec advisory DB issues a warning
when it appears in your dependency graph. memmap2 is a fork that is being
maintained, and is substantially more popular than the other suggested
alternative.

title: Update itertools requirement from 0.9 to 0.10

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Updates the requirements on [itertools](https://github.com/bluss/rust-itertools) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from itertools's changelog.

0.10.0

  • Increase minimum supported Rust version to 1.32.0
  • Improve macro hygiene (#507)
  • Add Itertools::powerset (#335)
  • Add Itertools::sorted_unstable, Itertools::sorted_unstable_by, and Itertools::sorted_unstable_by_key (#494)
  • Implement Error for ExactlyOneError (#484)
  • Undeprecate Itertools::fold_while (#476)
  • Tuple-related adapters work for tuples of arity up to 12 (#475)
  • use_alloc feature for users who have alloc, but not std (#474)
  • Add Itertools::k_smallest (#473)
  • Add Itertools::into_grouping_map and GroupingMap (#465)
  • Add Itertools::into_grouping_map_by and GroupingMapBy (#465)
  • Add Itertools::counts (#468)
  • Add implementation of DoubleEndedIterator for Unique (#442)
  • Add implementation of DoubleEndedIterator for UniqueBy (#442)
  • Add implementation of DoubleEndedIterator for Zip (#346)
  • Add Itertools::multipeek (#435)
  • Add Itertools::dedup_with_count and DedupWithCount (#423)
  • Add Itertools::dedup_by_with_count and DedupByWithCount (#423)
  • Add Itertools::intersperse_with and IntersperseWith (#381)
  • Add Itertools::filter_ok and FilterOk (#377)
  • Add Itertools::filter_map_ok and FilterMapOk (#377)
  • Deprecate Itertools::fold_results, use Itertools::fold_ok instead (#377)
  • Deprecate Itertools::map_results, use Itertools::map_ok instead (#377)
  • Deprecate FoldResults, use FoldOk instead (#377)
  • Deprecate MapResults, use MapOk instead (#377)
  • Add Itertools::circular_tuple_windows and CircularTupleWindows (#350)
  • Add peek_nth and PeekNth (#303)

0.9.0

  • Fix potential overflow in MergeJoinBy::size_hint (#385)
  • Add derive(Clone) where possible (#382)
  • Add try_collect method (#394)
  • Add HomogeneousTuple trait (#389)
  • Fix combinations(0) and combinations_with_replacement(0) (#383)
  • Don't require ParitalEq to the Item of DedupBy (#397)
  • Implement missing specializations on the PutBack adaptor and on the MergeJoinBy iterator (#372)
  • Add position_* methods (#412)
  • Derive Hash for EitherOrBoth (#417)
  • Increase minimum supported Rust version to 1.32.0

0.8.2

  • Use slice::iter instead of into_iter to avoid future breakage (#378, by @LukasKalbertodt)

0.8.1

  • Added a .exactly_one() iterator method that, on success, extracts the single value of an iterator ; by @Xaeroxe
  • Added combinatory iterator adaptors:

    • .permutations(k):

      [0, 1, 2].iter().permutations(2) yields

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 4dac4c7 (cargo-release) version 0.10.0
  • 8d27ab5 Merge #465
  • 5ad3e1a Merge #507
  • 79e39cb Add tests for macros hygiene
  • 807a1ce Add $crate:: path to izip! and iproduct! inner calls
  • 00756e0 Merge #473
  • 130ffd3 Merge #335
  • 4183f2c Update bors status
  • 67b7d74 more bors tweaks
  • 507d609 tweak workflow trigger
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
